title: Domaine Chenevières 2014  Chablis
description: This is a soft and creamy wine, ripe with baked apple and crisp pear flavors. Balanced and full in the mouth, it attractive and ready to drink.

title: Domaine d'Arton 2012 Les Deux Cèdres Gros Manseng (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: This is a well-balanced wine with honeyed ripeness contrasted with attractive, crisp acidity. Pineapple and baked-apple flavors are given a texture by the zing of the honey. It is ready to drink.

title: Ca' de Lion Ghione 2009 Barrique  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: Aromas of raisin, Oriental spice and resin emerge in the glass. The polished but evolved palate offers dried black cherry, mocha, clove and licorice alongside smooth, fleeting tannins. This has seen fresher days so drink soon.

title: Vite Colte 2013 La Luna e i Falò  (Barbera d'Asti Superiore)
description: This opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, mature berry, menthol and anise. The palate offers dried blackberry, raisin and licorice alongside close-grained tannins and brisk acidity.

title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2014 Niersteiner Paterberg Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Bramble and herb notes are prominent on the nose, but subside into succulent white grapefruit and tangerine on the palate of this cheerful off-dry Riesling. Sunny acidity adds to its approachable, easygoing feel. Drink now.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)
description: With a high proportion of Pinot Meunier in the blend, this is ripe, warm and accessible. Fresh apple and ripe pear flavors are cut by grapefruit acidity. The texture is soft, ripe and very ready to drink.

title: Baron-Fuenté NV Rosé Dolores Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a soft, open wine, lightly flavored with red fruits and with attractive acidity. A bright, lively mousse gives a lift to the palate, finishing with an orange-zest tang.

title: Bel Colle 2012 Monvijè  (Roero)
description: Attractive aromas of red berry, rose petal and a light note of cooking spice fill the glass. On the tightly wound palate, dried red cherry, sage and white pepper are offset by austere tannins that lead to a rather short, bracing finish.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2014 Off-Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Apple blossoms perfume pristine lemon, lime and tangerine in this invigorating off-dry Riesling. Vivacious and brisk, it's uncomplicated yet refreshingly thirst quenching. Drink now.

title: Montevina 2013 Independence Point Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Gobs of ripe fruit flavor and a smooth texture make this medium-bodied wine delicious and appealing. It smells like molasses and boysenberries, tastes jammy, and has no harsh tannins.

title: Obsidian 2011 Syrah (Oregon)
description: Immensely toasty aromas overcome the light fruit from the get-go. Thin flavors of raspberry and black-cherry candy carry it a while, but the oaky finish seems way out of proportion to the fruit.

title: Omero 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The unusually low finished alcohol suggests grapes picked a bit early. Scents of violets and light flavors of purple plums give way to an herbal midpalate, with streaks of graphite and bitter chocolate. The tannins are stiff and assertive.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2012 Undone Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)
description: Lusciously jammy notes of preserved black cherry and raspberry are forward and friendly in this simple yet consistent Pinot Noir. It's briskly balanced in acidity and wraps up neatly on the finish. Drink now.

title: Tabor 2012 Thunder Adama II Red (Galilee)
description: A blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine has a restrained nose of cranberry and toast. It has flavors of cherry, blueberry and toasted bread with a tart note of cranberry. It is easy drinking but falls flat on the finish.

title: Raineri Gianmatteo 2013 Cornole  (Dogliani)
description: Floral scents of violet and iris lead the nose on this informal red. The straightforward palate offers raw black cherry, cranberry and white pepper alongside firm, drying tannins that leave a raspy finish.

title: Red Car 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: High in acidity and low in oak, this is a white that pushes the limits, reflective of the extreme, cool-climate vineyards from which it sources. Fresh-squeezed lemon is the star, the wet-stone minerality razor sharp.

title: Rideau 2013 Estate Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dried black cherries, a hint of purple flowers and a touch of tar show on the closed nose of this wine. The palate is also extremely wound up at this stage, with hints of espresso and dark chocolate. Although the structure is impressive, it does not allow much flavor to escape right now.

title: Titora 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Judean Hills)
description: The color of slightly faded garnet, this wine has a bouquet of cassis and green pepper. Chalky tannins create a backdrop for flavors of tart cherry, lingonberry, bell pepper and petrol that make promises to the taste buds but fall short of delivering.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2013 Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: There is a good balance in this wine between fresh berry fruits and a firmer structure so the tannins are present while never hiding the attractive fruitiness. Simple and one-dimensional, it is still attractive and ready to drink.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2012 Forma de Arte Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: An immediately attractive fruity wine that's half-and-half Touriga Nacional and Cabernet Sauvignon. Neither of the two grapes' natural tannins show in this wine with its soft texture and blackberry fruitiness. It is ready to drink.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)
description: Light and fruity, this offers a lively mousse and crisp red currant and berry flavors. A slight bitterness detracts from what is otherwise a fresh wine.

title: Fiuza 2014 Oceanus Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo)
description: This is a solid and textured wine, bringing out structure and black fruit flavors. The wine has acidity and a fresher background giving shape to the ripe fruits. Drink now.

title: Laberinto 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Grassy aromas of red currant suggest cowhide. This has a grabby narrow palate with green-leaning raspberry flavors. Overall, this is fresh and wiry in style, with a choppy, mildly tannic finish.

title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Periquita Rosé (Península de Setúbal)
description: Just off-dry, this is a smooth, caramel and red fruit flavored wine. It has plenty of acidity to balance its soft texture, with red currant freshness coming in at the end. Drink now.

title: Melipal 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This is a severely oaked wine that sizzles and smokes with aromas of campfire, creosote, road tar and coconut. On the palate, it's concentrated but also brutish. Roasted oaky black-fruit flavors echo the nose, while mint and chocolate dominate the finish. Time can only help this come around.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Red (Alentejo)
description: A young and fruity wine that is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, red berry fruits and a juicy fresh character. Full of fruit with just a light structure, it can be drunk now.

title: Andeluna 2014 1300 Torrontés (Uco Valley)
description: Pungent oily, tropical aromas of pineapple and melon come with a distant shot of turpentine and/or chemical cleanser. In the mouth, this is round and melony, with solid framing. Citrus and lychee flavors finish with a light coating of bitter pith. Drink right away.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2014 Dom Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: While pressed apple and pear notes are ripe and concentrated, whiffs of allium and earth lend a savory, shadowy tone to this wine. Regardless, it's refreshing and dry in composure with moderately long length.

title: Martin & Weyrich 2012 Allegro Moscato (California)
description: Floral, grapefruity aromas and sweet honey and peach flavors make this a very effusive and fruity wine. Though rich with flavor it's not cloying and is light bodied.

title: Massucco 2012  Roero
description: Aromas of berry, toast and espresso lead the nose while the tight palate offers dried cherry and a hint of ground pepper. Firm, grippy tannins give it a mouth-drying finish.
